### getMinAnalyzeableBackedgeTakenCount() {#a56378412b516c96bbab7cd31b530e0ff}

Return the minimum of all analyzeable exit counts.

This is an upper bound on the actual exit count. If there are not at least two analyzeable exits, returns <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/scevcouldnotcompute">SCEVCouldNotCompute</a>.

<Link id="l00001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===-- LoopPredication.cpp - Guard based loop predication pass -----------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The LoopPredication pass tries to convert loop variant range checks to loop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// invariant by widening checks across loop iterations. For example, it will</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// convert</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   for (i = 0; i &lt; n; i++) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     guard(i &lt; len);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   for (i = 0; i &lt; n; i++) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     guard(n - 1 &lt; len);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// After this transformation the condition of the guard is loop invariant, so</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// loop-unswitch can later unswitch the loop by this condition which basically</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// predicates the loop by the widened condition:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   if (n - 1 &lt; len)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     for (i = 0; i &lt; n; i++) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//       ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   else</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     deoptimize</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// It&#39;s tempting to rely on SCEV here, but it has proven to be problematic.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Generally the facts SCEV provides about the increment step of add</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// recurrences are true if the backedge of the loop is taken, which implicitly</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// assumes that the guard doesn&#39;t fail. Using these facts to optimize the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// guard results in a circular logic where the guard is optimized under the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// assumption that it never fails.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For example, in the loop below the induction variable will be marked as nuw</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// basing on the guard. Basing on nuw the guard predicate will be considered</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// monotonic. Given a monotonic condition it&#39;s tempting to replace the induction</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// variable in the condition with its value on the last iteration. But this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// transformation is not correct, e.g. e = 4, b = 5 breaks the loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   for (int i = b; i != e; i++)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     guard(i u&lt; len)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// One of the ways to reason about this problem is to use an inductive proof</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// approach. Given the loop:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   if (B(0)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     do &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//       I = PHI(0, I.INC)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//       I.INC = I + Step</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//       guard(G(I));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     &#125; while (B(I));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// where B(x) and G(x) are predicates that map integers to booleans, we want a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// loop invariant expression M such the following program has the same semantics</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// as the above:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   if (B(0)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     do &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//       I = PHI(0, I.INC)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//       I.INC = I + Step</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//       guard(G(0) &amp;&amp; M);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     &#125; while (B(I));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// One solution for M is M = forall X . (G(X) &amp;&amp; B(X)) =&gt; G(X + Step)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Informal proof that the transformation above is correct:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   By the definition of guards we can rewrite the guard condition to:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     G(I) &amp;&amp; G(0) &amp;&amp; M</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   Let&#39;s prove that for each iteration of the loop:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     G(0) &amp;&amp; M =&gt; G(I)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   And the condition above can be simplified to G(Start) &amp;&amp; M.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   Induction base.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     G(0) &amp;&amp; M =&gt; G(0)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   Induction step. Assuming G(0) &amp;&amp; M =&gt; G(I) on the subsequent</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   iteration:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     B(I) is true because it&#39;s the backedge condition.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     G(I) is true because the backedge is guarded by this condition.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   So M = forall X . (G(X) &amp;&amp; B(X)) =&gt; G(X + Step) implies G(I + Step).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Note that we can use anything stronger than M, i.e. any condition which</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// implies M.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// When S = 1 (i.e. forward iterating loop), the transformation is supported</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// when:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   &#42; The loop has a single latch with the condition of the form:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     B(X) = latchStart + X &lt;pred&gt; latchLimit,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     where &lt;pred&gt; is u&lt;, u&lt;=, s&lt;, or s&lt;=.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   &#42; The guard condition is of the form</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     G(X) = guardStart + X u&lt; guardLimit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   For the ult latch comparison case M is:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     forall X . guardStart + X u&lt; guardLimit &amp;&amp; latchStart + X &lt;u latchLimit =&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//        guardStart + X + 1 u&lt; guardLimit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   The only way the antecedent can be true and the consequent can be false is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     X == guardLimit - 1 - guardStart</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   (and guardLimit is non-zero, but we won&#39;t use this latter fact).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   If X == guardLimit - 1 - guardStart then the second half of the antecedent is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart u&lt; latchLimit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   and its negation is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart u&gt;= latchLimit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   In other words, if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     latchLimit u&lt;= latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   then:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   (the ranges below are written in ConstantRange notation, where &#91;A, B) is the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   set for (I = A; I != B; I++ /&#42;maywrap&#42;/) yield(I);)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//      forall X . guardStart + X u&lt; guardLimit &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//                 latchStart + X u&lt; latchLimit =&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//        guardStart + X + 1 u&lt; guardLimit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   == forall X . guardStart + X u&lt; guardLimit &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//                 latchStart + X u&lt; latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart =&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//        guardStart + X + 1 u&lt; guardLimit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   == forall X . (guardStart + X) in &#91;0, guardLimit) &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//                 (latchStart + X) in &#91;0, latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart) =&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//        (guardStart + X + 1) in &#91;0, guardLimit)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   == forall X . X in &#91;-guardStart, guardLimit - guardStart) &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//                 X in &#91;-latchStart, guardLimit - 1 - guardStart) =&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//         X in &#91;-guardStart - 1, guardLimit - guardStart - 1)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   == true</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   So the widened condition is:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     guardStart u&lt; guardLimit &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart u&gt;= latchLimit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   Similarly for ule condition the widened condition is:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     guardStart u&lt; guardLimit &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart u&gt; latchLimit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   For slt condition the widened condition is:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     guardStart u&lt; guardLimit &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart s&gt;= latchLimit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   For sle condition the widened condition is:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     guardStart u&lt; guardLimit &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart s&gt; latchLimit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// When S = -1 (i.e. reverse iterating loop), the transformation is supported</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// when:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   &#42; The loop has a single latch with the condition of the form:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     B(X) = X &lt;pred&gt; latchLimit, where &lt;pred&gt; is u&gt;, u&gt;=, s&gt;, or s&gt;=.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   &#42; The guard condition is of the form</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     G(X) = X - 1 u&lt; guardLimit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   For the ugt latch comparison case M is:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     forall X. X-1 u&lt; guardLimit and X u&gt; latchLimit =&gt; X-2 u&lt; guardLimit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   The only way the antecedent can be true and the consequent can be false is if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     X == 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   If X == 1 then the second half of the antecedent is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     1 u&gt; latchLimit, and its negation is latchLimit u&gt;= 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   So the widened condition is:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     guardStart u&lt; guardLimit &amp;&amp; latchLimit u&gt;= 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   Similarly for sgt condition the widened condition is:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     guardStart u&lt; guardLimit &amp;&amp; latchLimit s&gt;= 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   For uge condition the widened condition is:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     guardStart u&lt; guardLimit &amp;&amp; latchLimit u&gt; 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   For sge condition the widened condition is:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     guardStart u&lt; guardLimit &amp;&amp; latchLimit s&gt; 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/scalar/looppredication-h">llvm/Transforms/Scalar/LoopPredication.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/statistic-h">llvm/ADT/Statistic.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/aliasanalysis-h">llvm/Analysis/AliasAnalysis.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/branchprobabilityinfo-h">llvm/Analysis/BranchProbabilityInfo.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/guardutils-h">llvm/Analysis/GuardUtils.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h">llvm/Analysis/ScalarEvolution.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/module-h">llvm/IR/Module.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/patternmatch-h">llvm/IR/PatternMatch.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/profdatautils-h">llvm/IR/ProfDataUtils.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/commandline-h">llvm/Support/CommandLine.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/debug-h">llvm/Support/Debug.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/scalar-h">llvm/Transforms/Scalar.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="277"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Return an insertion point suitable for inserting a safe to speculate</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// instruction whose only user will be &#39;User&#39; which has operands &#39;Ops&#39;.  A</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="279"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// trivial result would be the at the User itself, but we try to return a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="280"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// loop invariant location if possible.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="281"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;findInsertPt(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user">User</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;Value&#42;&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/demangle/itaniumdemangle-h/#a926d7ce2143863b7a2afda0fca4d2b65">Ops</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="282"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Same as above, &#42;except&#42; that this uses the SCEV definition of invariant</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// which is that an expression &#42;can be made&#42; invariant via SCEVExpander.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Thus, this version is only suitable for finding an insert point to be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// passed to SCEVExpander!</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;findInsertPt(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevexpander">SCEVExpander</a> &amp;Expander, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user">User</a>,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00390" /><CodeLine lineNumber="390"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;LHSV =</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="394"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilder">IRBuilder&lt;&gt;</a> Builder(findInsertPt(Guard, &#123;LHSV, RHSV&#125;));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="395"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Builder.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilderbase/#ae0bd6c2fab2d18443038a8f3a2b64856">CreateICmp</a>(Pred, LHSV, RHSV);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="396"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00397" /><CodeLine lineNumber="397"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00398" /><CodeLine lineNumber="398"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Returns true if its safe to truncate the IV to RangeCheckType.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00399" /><CodeLine lineNumber="399"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// When the IV type is wider than the range operand type, we can still do loop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="400"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// predication, by generating SCEVs for the range and latch that are of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00401" /><CodeLine lineNumber="401"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// same type. We achieve this by generating a SCEV truncate expression for the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="402"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// latch IV. This is done iff truncation of the IV is a safe operation,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="403"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// without loss of information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="404"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Another way to achieve this is by generating a wider type SCEV for the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="405"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// range check operand, however, this needs a more involved check that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="406"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// operands do not overflow. This can lead to loss of information when the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="407"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// range operand is of the form: add i32 %offset, %iv. We need to prove that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="408"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// sext(x + y) is same as sext(x) + sext(y).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="409"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This function returns true if we can safely represent the IV type in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="410"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the RangeCheckType without loss of information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="411" lineLink="#aad4139f2ea3959f2e9b10ea746e1265e"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#aad4139f2ea3959f2e9b10ea746e1265e">isSafeToTruncateWideIVType</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="412"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                       <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &amp;SE,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="413"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                       </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> LoopICmp LatchCheck,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="414"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                       <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;RangeCheckType) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="415"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!<a href="#a7cb1b8e1d62698a939a06f67a64bcbbf">EnableIVTruncation</a>)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00416" /><CodeLine lineNumber="416"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00417" /><CodeLine lineNumber="417"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>.getTypeSizeInBits(LatchCheck.IV-&gt;getType()).getFixedValue() &gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00418" /><CodeLine lineNumber="418"><span class="doxyHighlight">             <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>.getTypeSizeInBits(RangeCheckType).getFixedValue() &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00419" /><CodeLine lineNumber="419"><span class="doxyHighlight">         </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Expected latch check IV type to be larger than range check operand &quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00420" /><CodeLine lineNumber="420"><span class="doxyHighlight">         </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;type!&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00421" /><CodeLine lineNumber="421"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The start and end values of the IV should be known. This is to guarantee</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00422" /><CodeLine lineNumber="422"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// that truncating the wide type will not lose information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00423" /><CodeLine lineNumber="423"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;Limit = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;SCEVConstant&gt;</a>(LatchCheck.Limit);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="424"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;Start = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;SCEVConstant&gt;</a>(LatchCheck.IV-&gt;getStart());</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="425"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!Limit || !Start)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="426"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="427"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This check makes sure that the IV does not change sign during loop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="428"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// iterations. Consider latchType = i64, LatchStart = 5, Pred = ICMP&#95;SGE,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="429"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// LatchEnd = 2, rangeCheckType = i32. If it&#39;s not a monotonic predicate, the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="430"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// IV wraps around, and the truncation of the IV would lose the range of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00431" /><CodeLine lineNumber="431"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// iterations between 2^32 and 2^64.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00432" /><CodeLine lineNumber="432"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!SE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#aa92b3e6375805368f9a24cf69ce73797">getMonotonicPredicateType</a>(LatchCheck.IV, LatchCheck.Pred))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00433" /><CodeLine lineNumber="433"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00434" /><CodeLine lineNumber="434"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The active bits should be less than the bits in the RangeCheckType. This</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00435" /><CodeLine lineNumber="435"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// guarantees that truncating the latch check to RangeCheckType is a safe</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00436" /><CodeLine lineNumber="436"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// operation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00437" /><CodeLine lineNumber="437"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> RangeCheckTypeBitSize =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00438" /><CodeLine lineNumber="438"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>.getTypeSizeInBits(RangeCheckType).getFixedValue();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00439" /><CodeLine lineNumber="439"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Start-&gt;getAPInt().getActiveBits() &lt; RangeCheckTypeBitSize &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00440" /><CodeLine lineNumber="440"><span class="doxyHighlight">         Limit-&gt;getAPInt().getActiveBits() &lt; RangeCheckTypeBitSize;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00441" /><CodeLine lineNumber="441"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00442" /><CodeLine lineNumber="442"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00443" /><CodeLine lineNumber="443"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00444" /><CodeLine lineNumber="444"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Return an LoopICmp describing a latch check equivlent to LatchCheck but with</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="489"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;LoopPredication::findInsertPt(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevexpander">SCEVExpander</a> &amp;Expander,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00491" /><CodeLine lineNumber="491"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                           <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;const SCEV &#42;&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/demangle/itaniumdemangle-h/#a926d7ce2143863b7a2afda0fca4d2b65">Ops</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="492"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Subtlety: SCEV considers things to be invariant if the value produced is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00493" /><CodeLine lineNumber="493"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the same across iterations.  This is not the same as being able to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00494" /><CodeLine lineNumber="494"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// evaluate outside the loop, which is what we actually need here.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00495" /><CodeLine lineNumber="495"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a> : <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/demangle/itaniumdemangle-h/#a926d7ce2143863b7a2afda0fca4d2b65">Ops</a>)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00496" /><CodeLine lineNumber="496"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!SE-&gt;isLoopInvariant(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a>, L) ||</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="497"><span class="doxyHighlight">        !Expander.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevexpander/#a5c94af409fdce59362329aa65584482d">isSafeToExpandAt</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a>, Preheader-&gt;getTerminator()))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="498"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00499" /><CodeLine lineNumber="499"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Preheader-&gt;getTerminator();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00500" /><CodeLine lineNumber="500"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00501" /><CodeLine lineNumber="501"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00502" /><CodeLine lineNumber="502"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> LoopPredication::isLoopInvariantValue(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a>&#42; S) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00503" /><CodeLine lineNumber="503"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Handling expressions which produce invariant results, but &#42;haven&#39;t&#42; yet</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="504"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// been removed from the loop serves two important purposes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00505" /><CodeLine lineNumber="505"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 1) Most importantly, it resolves a pass ordering cycle which would</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00506" /><CodeLine lineNumber="506"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// otherwise need us to iteration licm, loop-predication, and either</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00507" /><CodeLine lineNumber="507"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// loop-unswitch or loop-peeling to make progress on examples with lots of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00508" /><CodeLine lineNumber="508"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// predicable range checks in a row.  (Since, in the general case,  we can&#39;t</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="509"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// hoist the length checks until the dominating checks have been discharged</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00510" /><CodeLine lineNumber="510"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// as we can&#39;t prove doing so is safe.)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00511" /><CodeLine lineNumber="511"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 2) As a nice side effect, this exposes the value of peeling or unswitching</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00512" /><CodeLine lineNumber="512"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// much more obviously in the IR.  Otherwise, the cost modeling for other</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="513"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// transforms would end up needing to duplicate all of this logic to model a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="514"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// check which becomes predictable based on a modeled peel or unswitch.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="515"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00516" /><CodeLine lineNumber="516"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The cost of doing so in the worst case is an extra fill from the stack  in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00517" /><CodeLine lineNumber="517"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the loop to materialize the loop invariant test value instead of checking</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00518" /><CodeLine lineNumber="518"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// against the original IV which is presumable in a register inside the loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00519" /><CodeLine lineNumber="519"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Such cases are presumably rare, and hint at missing oppurtunities for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00520" /><CodeLine lineNumber="520"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// other passes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00521" /><CodeLine lineNumber="521"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00522" /><CodeLine lineNumber="522"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (SE-&gt;isLoopInvariant(S, L))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00523" /><CodeLine lineNumber="523"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Note: This the SCEV variant, so the original Value&#42; may be within the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00524" /><CodeLine lineNumber="524"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// loop even though SCEV has proven it is loop invariant.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00525" /><CodeLine lineNumber="525"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00526" /><CodeLine lineNumber="526"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00527" /><CodeLine lineNumber="527"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Handle a particular important case which SCEV doesn&#39;t yet know about which</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00528" /><CodeLine lineNumber="528"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// shows up in range checks on arrays with immutable lengths.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00529" /><CodeLine lineNumber="529"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// TODO: This should be sunk inside SCEV.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00530" /><CodeLine lineNumber="530"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevunknown">SCEVUnknown</a> &#42;U = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;SCEVUnknown&gt;</a>(S))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00531" /><CodeLine lineNumber="531"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;LI = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;LoadInst&gt;</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ea4c614360da93c0a041b22e537de151eb">U</a>-&gt;getValue()))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00532" /><CodeLine lineNumber="532"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (LI-&gt;isUnordered() &amp;&amp; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ead20caec3b48a1eef164cb4ca81ba2587">L</a>-&gt;hasLoopInvariantOperands(LI))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00533" /><CodeLine lineNumber="533"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a728f79528ca8659e15d00c1e6818b316">isModSet</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/aa">AA</a>-&gt;getModRefInfoMask(LI-&gt;getOperand(0))) ||</span></CodeLine>
